pr_title: raids: add world region to scout overlay

timeline.bodyHTML:
Rather than effectively writing the code for the start of the world string twice, append the region string on a successful world service lookup.

Suggested change
String worldString;
WorldResult worldResult = worldService.getWorlds();
if (worldResult != null)
{
World currentWorld = worldResult.findWorld(client.getWorld());
String worldRegion = getRegion(currentWorld.getLocation());
worldString = "W" + currentWorld.getId() + " (" + worldRegion + ")";
}
else
{
worldString = "W" + client.getWorld();
}
String worldString = "W" + client.getWorld();
WorldResult worldResult = worldService.getWorlds();
if (worldResult != null)
{
String worldRegion = getRegion(currentWorld.getLocation());
worldString += " (" + worldRegion + ')';
}
timeline.author: Nightfirecat

timeline.body: This should be defined in an enum somewhere.
timeline.bodyText: This should be defined in an enum somewhere.
timeline.bodyHTML: This should be defined in an enum somewhere.
timeline.author: Nightfirecat

timeline.body: What number is this default case? This seems very unsafe in the event new regions are added.
timeline.bodyText: What number is this default case? This seems very unsafe in the event new regions are added.
timeline.bodyHTML: What number is this default case? This seems very unsafe in the event new regions are added.

timeline.body:
Instead of adding a comment at the top of the enum's body explaining the fields, add javadoc to the fields needing explaining. (renaming the field would make that clearer as well)
```suggestion
	/**
	 * ISO-3166-1 alpha-2 country code
	 */
	private final String alpha2;
```
timeline.bodyHTML:
Instead of adding a comment at the top of the enum's body explaining the fields, add javadoc to the fields needing explaining. (renaming the field would make that clearer as well)

Suggested change
private final String twoLetterCode;
/**
* ISO-3166-1 alpha-2 country code
*/
private final String alpha2;

@@ -0,0 +1,70 @@

+package net.runelite.http.api.worlds;
+
+import java.util.HashMap;
+import java.util.Map;
+import lombok.AllArgsConstructor;
+import lombok.Getter;
+
+/**
+ * Holds the data for each world's region (location)
+ */
+@AllArgsConstructor
+@Getter
+public enum WorldRegion
+{
+	// ISO-3166-1 alpha-2 and alpha-3 standard for country codes
+	UNITED_STATES_OF_AMERICA(0, "US", "USA"),
+	UNITED_KINGDOM(1, "GB", "GBR"),
+	AUSTRALIA(3, "AU", "AUS"),
+	GERMANY(7, "DE", "DEU");
+
+	private final int id;
+	private final String twoLetterCode;

timeline.body: This change would duplicate the icon/image initialization per table row generated. Instead, cache the icons in a `static` block (like was done before) using a `Map<WorldRegion, ImageIcon>`.
timeline.bodyText: This change would duplicate the icon/image initialization per table row generated. Instead, cache the icons in a static block (like was done before) using a Map<WorldRegion, ImageIcon>.
timeline.bodyHTML: This change would duplicate the icon/image initialization per table row generated. Instead, cache the icons in a static block (like was done before) using a Map<WorldRegion, ImageIcon>.
timeline.author: Nightfirecat

timeline.bodyHTML:
Mark this @Nullable

Suggested change
public static WorldRegion valueOf(int locationId)
@Nullable
public static WorldRegion valueOf(int locationId)

@@ -0,0 +1,70 @@
+/*
+ * Copyright (c) 2020, melky <https://github.com/melkypie>
+ * All rights reserved.
+ *
+ * Redistribution and use in source and binary forms, with or without
+ * modification, are permitted provided that the following conditions are met:
+ *
+ * 1. Redistributions of source code must retain the above copyright notice, this
+ *    list of conditions and the following disclaimer.

+ *    this list of conditions and the following disclaimer in the documentation
+ *    and/or other materials provided with the distribution.
+ *
+ * THIS SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED BY THE COPYRIGHT HOLDERS AND CONTRIBUTORS "AS IS" AND
+ * ANY EXPRESS OR IMPLIED WARRANTIES, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, THE IMPLIED
+ * WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE ARE
+ * DISCLAIMED. IN NO EVENT SHALL THE COPYRIGHT OWNER OR CONTRIBUTORS BE LIABLE FOR
+ * ANY DIRECT, INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL, SPECIAL, EXEMPLARY, OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES
+ * (INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, PROCUREMENT OF SUBSTITUTE GOODS OR SERVICES;
+ * LOSS OF USE, DATA, OR PROFITS; OR BUSINESS INTERRUPTION) HOWEVER CAUSED AND
+ * ON ANY THEORY OF LIABILITY, WHETHER IN CONTRACT, STRICT LIABILITY, OR TORT
+ * (INCLUDING NEGLIGENCE OR OTHERWISE) ARISING IN ANY WAY OUT OF THE USE OF THIS
+ * SOFTWARE, EVEN IF ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGE.
+ */
+package net.runelite.http.api.worlds;
+
+import java.util.HashMap;
+import java.util.Map;
+import lombok.AllArgsConstructor;
+import lombok.Getter;
+
+/**
+ * Holds the data for each world's region (location)
+ */
+@AllArgsConstructor
+@Getter
+public enum WorldRegion
+{
+	// ISO-3166-1 alpha-2 and alpha-3 standard for country codes
+	UNITED_STATES_OF_AMERICA(0, "US", "USA"),
+	UNITED_KINGDOM(1, "GB", "GBR"),
+	AUSTRALIA(3, "AU", "AUS"),
+	GERMANY(7, "DE", "DEU");
+
+	private final int id;
+	private final String twoLetterCode;
+	private final String threeLetterCode;
+
+	private static final Map<Integer, WorldRegion> REGIONS = new HashMap<>();
+
+	static
+	{
+		for (final WorldRegion worldRegion : WorldRegion.values())
+		{
+			REGIONS.put(worldRegion.id, worldRegion);
+		}
+	}
+
+	/**
+	 * Gets the region using the location id
+	 * {@link WorldRegion} value.
+	 *
+	 * @param locationId the location id of world
+	 * @return WorldRegion the region of the world
+	 */
+	public static WorldRegion valueOf(int locationId)

replies.bodyText: @Nullable doesn't seem to be available in http-api as travis was throwing out errors that it couldn't find com.sun.istack.internal

timeline.body: This type of thing becomes easy to miss later when adding a new world region. Keeping the previous code and changing getFlag to `getFlag(WorldRegion region)` can compile-time error due to the switch if you cover all possible enum values.
timeline.bodyText: This type of thing becomes easy to miss later when adding a new world region. Keeping the previous code and changing getFlag to getFlag(WorldRegion region) can compile-time error due to the switch if you cover all possible enum values.
timeline.bodyHTML: This type of thing becomes easy to miss later when adding a new world region. Keeping the previous code and changing getFlag to getFlag(WorldRegion region) can compile-time error due to the switch if you cover all possible enum values.
timeline.author: Adam-

replies.bodyText: Wouldn't it still throw an error since it couldn't find the file, if only an enum entry was added?
replies.author: melkypie

replies.bodyText: If it was run yes, but I don't think this is even tested so we wouldn't notice.
replies.author: Adam-

replies.bodyText: Added a test that would check for this
